ygData.subject: Re: resistance after patch
ygData.msgSnippet: * Raises Hand * I just love sticking things with my little dragoon dirk. The cool thing about that little weapon is, that with most monsters, after you cast
ygData.messageBody:
* Raises Hand *

I just love sticking things with my little dragoon dirk. The cool thing
about that little weapon is, that with most monsters, after you cast languid
pace on them, you can wait until they make their attack (against tank or
pet) step in, poke em once and step back out before they attack again. I
just love doing that...

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Scott Murawski [SMTP:scott@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, June 30, 1999 12:32 PM
> To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] resistance after patch
>
> From: Scott Murawski <scott@...>
>
> >From: "Andrea Maionchi" <okandrea@...>
>
> >The only way not to get resisted and works 100% of the time is to get up
> >real close.
>
> Does that really work? Resists based on distance?
>
> >I do tend to forget often that I am not a tank too and melee a lot, but
> that
> >is ok as we share damage together.
>
> You know, I do the same thing. Often I mele a bit too much and get put
> back in my place.
> I don't stay there long though, cause next fight (after I'm healed), I'm
> meleing again.
> The bad thing is, usually as soon as I step in and I don't even have to
> start meleing, the mob just turns to
> attack me and I get hit for too much damage. With my ruined totem staff,
> its just too hard to resist meleing.
>
> I wonder if many other enchanters mele too much also?
>
> Azboklin the enchanter
>
